item.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that the deployment of United States forces in Iraq be terminated immediately.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.title: Directing the Clerk of the House of Representatives to make a technical correction in the enrollment of H.R. 3058.

latestAction.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 210 - 202 (Roll no. 607). (text: CR H10994)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 210 - 202 (Roll no. 607).(text: CR H10994)
The previous question was ordered without objection. (consideration: CR H11004)
DEBATE - The House resumed debate on H. Res. 572.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 572.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H10993-11005)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 126.
Sec. 2. Upon adoption of this resolution, House Concurrent Resolution is hereby adopted.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-312, by Mr. Gingrey.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-312, by Mr. Gingrey.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of H. Res. 571 (expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that the deployment of U.S. forces in Iraq be terminated immediately, and providing for consideration of H. Con. Res. 308 directing the Clerk of the House to make a technical correction in the enrollment of H. R. 3058).

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
